Information Propagation "Chinese Character Encoding Character Set
1 This document specifies the sixteen-bit hexadecimal representation of the Chinese graphical characters and binary codes used in information technology.
This standard is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other textual graphic character information.

This specification is applicable to technical products that have the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other graphic characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, voice synthesis, text conversion, and handwriting recognition, as well as portable products represented by computers, communication terminals, electronic book readers, learning machines, etc.
2. Include files
The contents of the following documents are incorporated by reference as if fully set forth herein.

The reference files are those that are marked with a date. Only the version corresponding to that date applies to this file; the reference files that are not marked with a date, the latest version (including all the changes) applies to this file.
GB2312.1-1980 “Information Exchange Coding Character Set” Basic Set
GB11383 Part 1: 1989 Information processing "Information interchange code structures and coding rules"
GB13000 Information technology -- Universal character set (UCS)
3. Terms and Definitions
The following terms and definitions apply to this document.
3.1 Character
an element of a set of elements used to provide organization, control, or representation of data.
3.2 Coded Character
characters (3.1) and their encodings are shown.
3.3 User-Defined Private Use Area
The user of the product complying with this standard may define the area of use by himself.
3.4 repertoire
a specified character set (3.1) that is represented by a set of encoding characters (3.2) .
3.5 reserved zone
and leave the rest for future designation.
four-word phrases
4.1 Overview
The characters in this file are encoded as single bytes, double bytes, or four bytes.
The single-byte part includes all 128 characters of GB11383-1 1989 from 0x00 to 0x7F.
4.3 Two-Byte Part
The double-byte part includes all the graphical characters in GB2312.1-1980 and the CJK Unified Ideographs and some graphical characters in GB13000.
characters in the double-byte part are encoded according to the rules in Annex A.
The semantic descriptor must have a graphical representation, a code location, and a function that conform to the requirements of Appendix B.
Note GB13000 is the unified code for Chinese, Japanese, Korea, Vietnam, etc.
Assign unique code points to the characters with unique abstract forms, and assign shared code points to the characters with the same abstract forms but different origins.
Coded characters are called CJK, which stands for Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and CCJK Unified Ideographs is the Unicode standard for Chinese characters.
4.4 Four-byte part

The four-byte part includes 66 CJK Unified Ideographs (U+9FA6 to U+9FEF, excluding U+9FB4 to U+9FBB, which are 8 characters) and CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension B, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension C, CJK Unified Ideographs Extension D, CJK Un
characters in four-byte sequences are encoded according to the rules in Annex C.
5. Overall structure
In the text, numbers preceded by 0x are in hexadecimal, and numbers not preceded by 0x are in decimal.
all encodings in the appendix are in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
The single-byte part uses the encoding structure of GB11383-1989, using the code bits 0x00~0x7F.

The double-byte contribution is represented by two eight-bit binary digits for a character, with the first byte code bit starting from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second byte code bit ranging from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part uses GB11383-1989, which does not use 0x30, 0x31, 0x39 as the suffix for the extension of the double-byte code, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 ~ 0xFE39FE39.

The first character of a four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x8130813

6.1. Lexicographic order of words with prefixes
The characters of a word are sorted according to the order of the corresponding characters in GB11383-1989.
6.2. Ordering of Characters in Double-Byte Characters
the order of the characters in the lower part of the double characters should be in accordance with Appendix A.
6.3. Ordering of characters in the four-character code

The 50400 bits from 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39 correspond to all characters in the GB13000 basic multilingual plane that are not included in the double-byte part, and are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in the GB13000 basic multilingual plane.

The 1,058,400 bits from 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39 are used to map the 16 auxiliary planes of GB13000. The order of the characters is completely in accordance with the order of the corresponding bits of the 16 auxiliary planes of GB13000.
the order of characters in a four @-@ byte sequence must be consistent with Appendix C.

8. Description of characters and codes
Relative to GB 18030-1 2005 , some characters and / or their corresponding GBI 13000 code positions have been adjusted in this file ( see Appendix D ) .
9.1 In general
This document defines three levels of implementation.
System software products that are compliant with a given implementation level shall provide input/output functionality for all characters within the implementation level range.
9.2 Level 1 implementation

This specification defines the single-byte encoding, double-byte encoding, and four-byte encoding of CJK Unified Ideographs (U+2E80 to U+9FFF) and CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A (U+3400 to U+4DBF) for Level 1 of the Unicode Standard.
Any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements for level 1.
Note: According to the software application, level 1 can also be implemented with any or all of the non-Chinese languages listed in Table 3.
9.3 Level 2 Implementation
level 2 includes level 1.
In addition, level 2 also includes the encoding of kanji that are not included in level 1 of the Unicode Han Character Database.
The code positions and glyphs of the kanji collected in the Unicode Han Character Database are shown in Appendix.
system software and support software shall meet the requirements of Level 2.

Note: System software and software for literature include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, and middleware (for information on product classification of software, see GB36475).
9.4 Level 3 implementation
level 3 includes level 2.
In addition, all kanji and tables specified in the level 3 standard are implemented.
products intended for use in the administration of government or in the provision of public services must meet the requirements of Level 3.

Note: Public administration and defence; compulsory social security; rail transport; road transport; water transport; air transport; multi-modal transport; transport agents; postal services; banking, insurance and pension funding; land transport; administrative and support services; waste management and remediation activities; public administration; compulsory social security. (For information on the classification of industries, see GB4754.)

If we notice that the contents of a page in this manual are out of date and causing obvious confusion and complaints, we will stop publishing it. There is no other choice, since we don't have time to update Info files along with the man pages, as part of our work maintaining GCC. C and C++ compilers are integrated. They all process input files through one or more of the four steps: preprocessing, compilation ( Hii ), ( assembly ) MERE ( linking ) .
source files are marked with a language identifier, but for the compiler, the suffix controls the default settings:
gcc considers the preprocessed file (.i) to be a C file and sets up C linkage,
g++ considers the preprocessed file (.i) to be a C++ file and sets up C++ style linkage.
the source file suffix indicates the language type and the later operations:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cc C++ source; preprocess, compile, link
. CXX C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.m Objective-C source file; preprocess, compile, link
.i Preprocessed c files; compile, weave
.ii Preprocessed c++ file; compile, link
.s   assemble source program; assemble
compiling language source programs; preprocessing, compiling
.h Preprocessor file; these files are usually not seen on the command line, other than when the lower-level names file is passed to the linker (Linker). Typically includes:
.0 Object file
.a Archive file
unless the -cec, -s, or -E option is used (or a compilation error prevents the entire process), the linking step is always the last one.

in the linking stage , all .e files , -1 files , and files with unrecognized names ( including specified .o h files and .a files ) are passed to the linker options ( OPTIONS ) in the order specified on the command line .
The options must be given separately : `-d' is not the same as `-r'.
Most `-=E :and` `-W' options have two opposite formats : `-fname` and `-fno-name` (or `-Wname` and `-Wno- name`).
Only non-default formats are listed here.
The following is a summary of all options, grouped by type, with explanations to follow.

This will disable some GNU extensions that are not ANSI C compliant, as well as extensions that indicate rare and seldom used ANSI trigraph features, such as unix and vax.

The list of features to be removed from the language starts here, trying to support some aspects of traditional C compilers.

except one: for C++ programs (not C), the `-traditional` option has an additional effect, allowing assignment to `this`.
He's like the -Ethis-is-variable option.
-traditional-cpp tries to support some aspects of the traditional C preprocessor.
In particular, this applies to the contents mentioned above about the preprocessor, but not to the other effects of the `-traditional' option.
-fdollars-in-identifiers allows the `$' character to be used in identifiers (only for C++).
you can specify the -Efno-dollars-in-identifiers option to make it explicit that the use of the $ character is disallowed.
(GNU C++ allows the `$' character by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversion from ant type to enumeration type (enumeration) (MEF c++).
Normally, GNU C++ allows conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-templates  Generate smaller code for template declarations ( template declarations ) ( only in C++ ) by generating a copy of each template function only where they are defined .
To use this option successfully, you must mark all files that use the template with `#pragma implementation` (definition) or `#Pragma interface` (declaration).

The program uses `-fexternal-templates` at compile time, so that all template instantiations (template instantiation) are external types. You must ensure that the required instances appear in the implementation file.
This can be achieved with typedef , which references each instance that is needed.
Correspondingly, if the compiler is invoked with the default option `-fno-extern-templates', all template instances are explicitly set to be inline.
All member functions (except for constructor functions and mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual functions of the class in which they are defined.
This does not mean that every invocation of a member function will go through the internal vtable.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in such cases, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch allows the second and third arguments of a condition expression to have different types.
The value of this expression is void. -fthis-is-variable allows assignment to this (only in C++).
After incorporating user-defined free-store management into C++, assignable `this' seems inappropriate.
Therefore, by default, assigning this to itself in a type member function is an invalid operation.
However, to make this operation valid for backward compatibility, you can use the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char  Treat char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type , which may be unsigned char or signed char .
Ideally , when you depend on the symbolic meaning of data , a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char .
However, many programs are already written using simple chars, and expect these to be signed numbers (or unsigned numbers, depending on the target machine).
This option and its opposite option make the program work with the corresponding default values.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it represents the same thing as one of the other.
If no ` signed' or ` unsigned' specifier is explicitly given, the options define a signed or unsigned bitfield.
By default, bitfields are signed, because they inherit the basic integer type, such as int, which is signed, but if the `-traditional' option is specified, bitfields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in the writable data segment and doesn't do anything special.
This is for compatibility with some old programs that think it's a bad idea to change string constants, `-traditional' option has the same effect.

The impact of COVID-19 on the drug market
The impact could be similar to the 2008 financial crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.
in many countries , the disease has overwhelmed health services and pushed governments to impose drastic restrictions that have wreaked havoc on the global economy .
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be profound.
some producers may be forced to seek new ways to produce drugs because restrictions on mobility also limit access to precursors and basic chemicals .
Shippers may have to find new routes and methods because of travel restrictions.
drug use and distribution patterns may change , and government response capabilities may be hampered .
The changes brought by the COVID-19 pandemic are unprecedented, but we can still learn from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some addicts began to look for cheaper synthetic substances and the pattern of use shifted to injection.
At the same time, governments have cut back on funding for drug-related programs.
if governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way , interventions and treatment services to prevent drug use and related risk behaviors may be severely affected .
In addition , the priority given to interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced , making it easier for traffickers to operate .
Some countries have large amounts of drugs smuggled in through commercial flights, and these countries are expected to be most directly affected by drug trafficking.

Messengers carry drugs such as methamphetamine in their carry-on bags or in their checked luggage, sometimes in large quantities . Because almost all countries have restrictions on air travel , the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs could be completely shut down .
While the international postal supply chain has been disrupted, the use of the dark web and mailing goods may increase.
In the long term , economic downturn and related measures may disrupt the drug market.

As a result of rising unemployment and lack of opportunities , poverty and vulnerable populations are more likely to turn to drug use in a harmful way , develop a drug addiction , and engage in illegal activities related to drug production or transportation.
Drug cartels may take advantage of the situation by providing services to vulnerable populations and recruiting new members to bolster their ranks.
As government response capacity declines, these changes may take root quickly and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
market growth
population growth patterns in part explain the expansion of markets
The drug abuse phenomenon is increasing all over the world, whether it is from the overall number or from the proportion of drug abusers in the world population.

In 2009, an estimated 210 million people, or 4.8% of the global population aged 15–64 years, were estimated to be users of drugs, whereas in 2018, an estimated 269 million people, or 5.3% of the global population aged 15–64 years, were estimated to be users of drugs.
over the past 20 years , the growth rate of drug abuse in developing countries has far exceeded that of developed countries.

This reflects to some extent the differential growth of the total population over this period, with developed countries growing by 7 per cent and developing countries by 28 per cent, but also reflects the faster growth of the youth population in developing countries.
Young people and young adults account for the largest proportion of drug users.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population aged 15 to 64 in developing countries grew by 16%, while the population in this age group in developed countries shrank by 10%.
1 urbanization is a driving force in the current and future drug markets
regardless of whether it is a developed country or a developing country , the drug abuse situation in urban areas is more serious than that in rural areas.

The overall increase in drug abuse is partly due to the large-scale migration of people from rural areas to cities. At present, more than half of the world's population live in urban areas, while in 1960, this figure was only 34%.
urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , especially in countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced .

increases in wealth are associated with increases in drug use , but the burden of disease falls most heavily on the poorest people in the world , and drug use is more widespread in developed than in developing countries.
Cocaine and other drugs are more tightly linked to wealthier parts of the world.
similarly , within countries , rates of drug use are higher among the more affluent .
But the rate of addiction is higher among people with lower social and economic status.
data from a few countries suggest that harmful patterns of tobacco use and disease burden are linked to low income .
these patterns are less common in more affluent social strata .
The global economic crisis caused by the COVID @-@ 19 pandemic is likely to exacerbate the risk of the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have long been associated with increased drug use, and this pandemic has already forced millions of people around the world out of work.

COVID‐19 may further expand the drug market COVID‐19 's pandemic may lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illicit cultivation of crops , or because of reduced capacity of regulatory authorities , or because more people may be forced to engage in illicit activities under economic crisis.

The restrictions related to COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, which may have increased sea transport, as the risk of interception is lower and the amount of smuggling is greater than by air or land.
There have been recent reports that coca is being shipped directly from South America to Europe by sea.
complexity enhancement
The situation with non @-@ controlled substances is stable , but the market for new synthetic opioids with potential dangers is growing more complex.

in addition to the plant drugs marijuana , cocaine , and heroin , hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added , many of which are not under international control . Nonmedical use of drugs is also increasing rapidly .
Member countries have about 500 new active substances in their domestic markets each year.
most of these are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a few synthetic opioids .
although the overall number of new psychotropic drugs has stabilized , the proportions have changed .
In 2014, the new psychoactive substances classified as opioids accounted for only 2% of the total, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.

many of the new synthetic psychoactive substances are analogues of fentanyl , and their toxicity and lethality have been established , with overdose deaths occurring in North America and elsewhere , but to a lesser extent .
In North America , fentanyl is used in adulterants for heroin and other drugs ( including ketamine and methamphetamine ) , and in counterfeit pills containing fentanyl or fentanyl analogues.

Some evidence suggests that Europe is also experiencing the injection of new psychoactive substances that stimulate: a study of residual materials from discarded syringes in six European cities found that many syringes were contaminated with substances that produce stimulating effects.
the use of two new psychostimulants may become increasingly entrenched in vulnerable populations
single-class novel psychostimulants have rarely formed large markets .
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among homeless people and prisoners.
twenty‐two countries reported on the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with the synthesis of cannabinoids identified as the main challenge in most countries .

The most common innovation that drug manufacturers are forced to make in response to the control of precursor chemicals is that many chemical substances used to synthesize phenylacetone, phenethylamine, and "nodules" and other drugs have been placed under international control.
Dealers and chemists have long sought alternatives to controlled substances, including chemical compounds specifically designed to evade controls, known as "precursors."
Restrictive measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 may further squeeze drug traffickers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico indicates that this has become a reality: according to the report, the shortage of diisocyanate precursors imported from East Asia in March 2020 led to an increase in the price of diisocyanate in Mexico and the United States.
the market is always changing
Synthetic opioids replace heroin in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the heroin market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has fallen by more than 80 per cent since the Russian authorities began intercepting heroin shipments.
But the market for stimulants seems to be growing.
there is evidence that aniline and various cassia alkaloids , including cassia orange and a @-@ tertiary-butylbenzophenone , are now widely available on the Russian drug market .

The number of secretly operating drug production facilities recently discovered by Russian authorities has surged dramatically, doubling in the past two years to 1,520 in 2018, the government reported.
Afghanistan and Iraq Methamphetamine Markets Grow
as early as 2012 , investigations of hospital , prison , and other personnel in Iraq had revealed the importance of TCE.
Methylphenidate has become another worrisome mainstay of treatment beyond "Fentanyl and Versed."
A study in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with smokers saying that marijuana was harder to obtain than "bath salts" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methylbenzylamine processing points, and the Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern over the large-scale importation of precursors for the synthesis of methcathinone, which are used as precursors at one methylbenzylamine processing point.
in Afghanistan , production of urea appears to have started in 2014 .
Since then, the amount of methylbenzylamine seized has been steadily increasing.
However, the seizure amount in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg - a sharp increase compared to the previous year.
The seizure of large quantities of methamphetamine believed to be from Afghanistan in other countries also indicates that the country's production is on the rise.
policy changes and trends
the legalization of marijuana for nonmedical use has been associated with increased marijuana use in most of the states in which it has been legalized .
Canada, Uruguay and the United States are among 11 countries that allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
in most jurisdictions , marijuana use has increased since its legalization , although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized marijuana for nonmedical use .

In the two earliest states to legalize marijuana for adult use, Colorado and Washington, the prevalence of adult marijuana use has increased, especially among those who use daily or almost daily and those who used in the past month, since 2012, when the prevalence exceeded the national average.
All indicators show that marijuana use has increased in Uruguay since 2011, and almost doubled last month.
This suggests that the main reason for the increase is frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
Canada's short-term data also show that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, so did consumption.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from an illegal source.
Is the global drop in cannabis seizures due to legalization?
In 2018, global cannabis seizures fell to the lowest level in 20 years, due to a 84% drop in North America over the past decade.

In contrast, cannabis seizures nearly doubled in other parts of the world during the same period. The pattern of cannabis seizures suggests that policies aimed at opening up the marijuana market have played a key role in the decline.

the regulation of new psychoactive substances seems to have a dampening effect , but it is still difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of the regulation of new psychoactive substances in the country.
some countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances have different prevalence rates of use of these substances .
in other countries , the use of novel psychoactive substances has decreased after the introduction of national legislation .
opioids for pain management and palliation are primarily available in high @-@ income countries where there is uneven distribution of opioids for pain relief .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of the countries with available data had high income economies .
About 50% are in North America , 40% in Europe , and 2% in Oceania .
These countries account for about 12 percent of the world's population.
Estimates suggest that 88 % of the world's population live in low-income and middle @-@ income countries , but only 9.7 % of opioid consumption occurs in these countries .
access to opioids for medical use is influenced by many factors , including legislation , culture , health systems , and prescribing practices .

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Official: Reception Process Bottleneck - ECNS.cn
EU summit fails to resolve migrant policy dispute, EU official: bottlenecks exist in every step of the reception process

(Reuters, February 10) According to the report of the French news agency on the same day, at the latest EU summit, EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt more stringent policies on illegal immigrants to make it easier to expel them.
The move is reportedly a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe. The core problem of the EU is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize large amounts of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and monitoring.
However, the EU and its member states continue to argue over the payment of border costs.
Fendelien has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for these costs.

But some member states' diplomats say that if the EU can shoulder part of the cost of installing cameras, lighthouses and other infrastructure along the external borders, this would help countries to speed up the construction process by freeing up national budgets.

The Euractiv website said that EU officials admitted that there are bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, and that the limited reception capacity and the immigration authorities of the member states, which cannot bear the burden, cannot stop the refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in various EU countries. The EU refugee reception system is in a "near permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, the EU countries received more than 92,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly half compared with the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 33,000 illegal entries last year.
Against this backdrop, the summit has agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can expel illegal migrants to another member state based on the judgment of the latter's court.
In addition, the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to draw up a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifei)
US Upgrades “Chip War” to Reshape Global Semiconductor Industry - Eastday.com

Recently, the United States has upgraded its “chip war” against China. First, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to launch export control on China’s semiconductor manufacturing equipment under US pressure. Then, foreign media reported that the US government was considering cutting off all connections between US suppliers and Huawei, and prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei. The Biden administration is also preparing to issue an administrative order to restrict US investment in sensitive Chinese technology industries.

In recent years, the United States has never stopped attacking China's "core" development, on the one hand, accurately suppressing the supply chain of Sino-US semiconductor production, and on the other hand, building a "de-China" semiconductor production industry chain alliance, in order to completely "discard" China in the advanced semiconductor production industry.

Whether it is to establish a "technological alliance" with South Korea to build a "chip quadrilateral alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and China Taiwan, or to build a "small circle" of the semiconductor industry chain through mechanisms such as the "four-party mechanism" and the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework" between the United States and Japan, Australia, and India, the United States is using political, factional, and weapon
However, the US’s high-profile “chip war” against China is also a “wounding the enemy and injuring oneself”.

Recently, the well-known American chip manufacturing equipment supplier, the GSR Group, announced that due to the influence of the latest round of export ban on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment, the group will lay off 1,300 full-time employees, and plans to lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters.

ASML, the world's largest maker of semiconductor lithography machines, recently warned that a ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

US media analysis shows that many US companies have been severely affected by the US government's heavy-handed suppression of China's semiconductor and semiconductor industries, including EDA tool developers, chip designers, manufacturers of wafer fabrication equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has formed a closely connected global semiconductor industry chain.

According to experts, due to professional division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross national borders more than 70 times, and the whole process takes 100 days.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process engineering, and is heavily dependent on the Asia-Pacific region.

Even if the United States is leading the advanced semiconductor supply chain to develop in the "small circle" area, it is difficult to change the global distribution and interdependence of the semiconductor industry.
The United States is strongly "reforming" and "de-Sinicization" of the semiconductor industry chain, and re-creating the global semiconductor industry.
The chip is the core of the global future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, such as the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 Competition Act, and the Chips and Science Act, to use its technological dominance to consolidate its technological leadership advantage; and it has used "carrots and sticks" to coerce chip manufacturing companies such as Intel, TSMC, and Samsung to set up factories in the United States, in order
In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US pressure on Huawei and the push to restrict China's semiconductor industry will cause the US to lose a huge Chinese market, ultimately greatly weaken the innovative will and ability of US technology companies, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.

First batch of individual pension financial products go on sale, with the shortest holding period of 360 days - East Money Net
The first batch of individual pension financial products goes on sale
Seven products are available for the home appliance category, with the shortest holding period being 360 days.
The personal pension financial products have finally been launched.

On February 10, China Finance Network published the first list of individual pension financial products, and seven individual pension financial products of Guo Shang Bank, Agricultural Bank of China, and China Postal Savings Bank officially went on sale.

So far, the "shelf" of personal pension account has finally gathered four types of products of personal pension savings, personal pension financial management, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund.

According to the introduction, the first batch of individual pension financial products are all public offerings of net asset value type open-ended products, of which 5 are newly issued products and 2 are continuing products. Among them, there is 1 mixed type product, and the remaining 6 products are fixed income type products.

A reporter from Beijing Youth Daily saw that among the five new products, four came from Guotai Junan Securities, all of which were fixed-income products, with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10

The remaining new product is "Bank of Communications Wealth Addition·Hongqi Shortest Holding 1095 Days No. 1", which is also a fixed-income product, and will start collecting on February 10 and end on February 19, with a risk level of II.

Among the two continuing products, one is the Agricultural Bank of China "Agricultural Bank of China·Spirit of Dedication" 360-day technological innovation RMB wealth management product, which has an investment nature of mixed type and a risk level of three.

Another continuing product is "Bank of East Asia Wealth Enhancement HK$1000 with the shortest holding period of 365 days", which is a fixed-income type, and started collecting funds on December 30 last year, officially started operation on January 4 this year, and the accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension Funds, the financial products that can be invested in the personal pension fund account include bank wealth management, deposits, commercial pension insurance, public fund management, etc.

The first batch of personal pension fund financial products went on sale, marking that investors of personal pension funds can officially purchase financial products through personal pension fund account.
Last November, the CBIRC issued the Temporary Measures for the Administration of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Life Insurance Companies.

The Regulations stipulate that the participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, personal pension public fund products, etc. through their personal pension fund account.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued notices to clarify that the pilot program of the individual pension scheme would be launched in 36 cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang in Hebei Province, Xiong’an New Area in Hebei Province, and Jinan in Shandong Province.

As of the end of 2022, the number of people participating in the individual pension plan was 19.54 million, the number of contributors was 6.13 million, and the total contribution amount was 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, the pilot banks only launched three types of products, namely personal pension savings, personal pension insurance and personal pension public fund products.
Now that personal pension financial products have gathered, how should investors choose?

An expert from the R&D Department of Taishin Securities Investment Products said that trial-stage pension investment products and individual pension investment products have three characteristics compared with other individual pension products.
First, stability, risk management mechanisms are more complete, investment strategies and ideas are more stable, and third-party independent custody is implemented.

Second, they are long-term. The trial period for long-term care insurance products for the elderly is more than 5 years, and the next step will be the issuance of personal pension insurance products, with the minimum holding period being one year, and encouraged to hold for more than 3 years.

The third is inclusiveness. The purchase threshold of the product is low, and the general purchase point is 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The rate of custody fees, management fees, etc. of the product is more preferential.
Experts said that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the product and their risk tolerance.

Individual pension savings have the characteristics of long-term preservation, high interest rates and high security, which are suitable for people with weak risk-bearing ability; individual pension insurance products emphasize security, which are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; while individual pension financial products and public funds are not guaranteed to maintain the principal or returns, have certain investment risks, but the expected returns are higher, which are suitable for people who have certain financial knowledge and

Fitness Industry Should Shun Trust Crisis - Eastday.com
Another large-scale fitness club "explosion"?
Recently, the issue of the Zhenjian Fitness Club members' rights protection has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that the stores they were in were not operating normally. Subsequently, rumors about the closure of the institution caused members to panic, leading to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the responsible person of the institution came forward to respond and promised to make efforts to ensure the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, which helped to calm the storm.

Some individual fitness centers have encountered operational problems and temporarily closed their doors. Consumers can be patient and wait for the problem to be resolved. Why do some members react with “something is wrong”?
Behind the member rights protection storm of the fitness club, there is a deep-seated problem of trust crisis in the industry.
Traditional gyms in China usually adopt the prepaid model, and the logic of "earning money from users who do not come" is the bottom line of their development.

By obtaining cash flow through pre-sale membership cards and opening new stores, it seems that the cycle can be repeated, but in fact, it is like eating the tiger's meat and eating the hare's meat, and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
The negative information about gyms, running and other industries is frequently released, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, of course, fitness clubs can be said to be a "money-making" good business.
The fitness competition may be up and down, but it always attracts capital attention.
Multiple data show that the temperature of the cultural consumption sector continues to rise, and the market continues to warm up.

Specifically, in the fitness market, as residents' living standards gradually improve, the concept of a healthy lifestyle has deeply rooted in people's hearts, and the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to focus on quality development.

However, individual institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery, and they are just coming out of the crisis, blowing the horn of opening up and expanding, and pouring the funds into the construction of new stores.

It cannot be denied that in recent years, the pandemic has caused many institutions to withdraw, the industry to reorganize, and powerful enterprises to selectively increase their acquisition strength and repositioning, which has brought new opportunities.
However, in order for the fitness market to develop into a virtuous cycle, the industry must change its traditional model and change its business strategy.
Only by firmly establishing consumer trust and security can we truly win the market and the future.
Instead of seizing the market like the new store of Dabeinong, the fitness industry needs to focus on optimizing services and building a high-quality user base.
First, you have to keep users by providing services.

Fitness centers belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to the "user-oriented" principle, to closely surround the needs of users, and to put the focus of operation on the improvement of service quality.
Second, we need to improve the user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the current popular Internet fitness club model realizes that users pay per visit and choose the venue.
At the same time, physical data and sports data can be effectively used to meet social needs and realize a complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private tutoring promotion and annual membership fees, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness institutions are reduced, and trust is improved.
In addition, we need to actively explore diversified business models.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption, and fitness clubs have the potential to become a new entry point for consumption. Surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment will become new profit points, providing consumers with more choices.

The price difference between buying and selling!
Nanjing Tower City Repeats "Differential Price Refund" - Eastday.com

Yangzi Evening News (Reporter: Ma Shibo) Yangzi Evening News/Zhiniu News reporter found on the 10th that the “price agreement” has returned to the Nanjing Loushi after more than a decade, and a floor plate in the Jiangbei New Area claimed that the “difference in price” was greater than the discount of other housing before moving in, and the developer was willing to exchange housing and refund the difference
The conditions for the "price agreement" are not few.

The apartment building is located in Jiangbei New District and is called Boli Yucai Cloud Terrace. Mr. Sun, the prospective buyer, told the reporter that he found a "declaration" when he was touring the apartment building last weekend.

The developer promised in the pictures he sent to the media that if the buyer bought a house in the project from February 1 to February 28, and the discount of other houses in the project was higher than the discount of the house he bought before (limited to the same type of house, the same building, the same unit, the same property type as the house he bought before), the developer would refund the difference and change the house for the buyer.

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was a "price agreement", the purpose was to let the buyer feel at ease to buy, and not to worry about the developer lowering the price to promote, "Now I am afraid that after buying it, it will be lowered, and there will be a lot of trouble at the sales office. If there is no trouble, it is indeed a good deal."
Many buyers also believe that the "price agreement" is a "pill" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who plans to buy a house in the southern part of the Yangtze River, said that the price of the house first depends on the same type of house, and then on the same building and the same unit. Therefore, the "threshold" is still relatively high.
Some buyers also believe that, due to information asymmetry, it is not easy for them to "claim rights" when selling, and there may be additional discounts.
Whether the buyer can stay is worth observing

According to the reporter's inquiry on the online real estate platform of Nanjing, the sale of the apartment was approved last November, with a total of 252 units, including 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the average price of the fully furnished apartment was 39,843 yuan/m2.

However, two months later, the online real estate market showed that the total number of unsold units in the project was 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 8th floor had 128 units, unsold units were 113, 7th floor had 124 units, of which 44 were unsold, and the total transaction of the project was only 33 units, accounting for only 13
Market insiders said that the "price agreement" had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Heshi Yellow Mountain Road project, Xihe West Garden, launched a "Price Guarantee Plan", which means that the company guarantees that if the discount is expanded within one year, the company will refund the difference to the original owner.
In April 2011, nine property developers in Nanjing also promised to pay the difference for the apartments.
"The housing market is warming up, and now is the time to use a "strong heart medicine".
"Mr. Shen, a veteran operator in the real estate industry in Nanjing, said that the "price agreement" is also a marketing method for real estate companies.
He believes that developers need more confidence than home buyers, and the launch of the "price agreement" is to boost their morale.
As for whether the buyers can stay, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as control policies and loan threshold, and it needs to be observed for the time being.
Multiple data show that Taiwan's economy is not good at the beginning of the year - East Money Network

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (Reporters: Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) Export trade volume "fell five black", the manufacturing procurement manager index (PMI) continued to shrink for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) also saw "three-character head"... Recently, Taiwan's authorities have been releasing economic data for January 2023.
Economists believe that Taiwan's economy is not performing well at the beginning of the year, and the pressure of growth is not small.

According to the financial affairs administration department of the Taiwan region, the region's exports in January 2019 were US$3.151 billion, a year-on-year decrease of 21.2%, marking the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export value of 11 major export commodities all decreased compared with the same period last year.
The decline of rubber and its products, and optical instruments was the most significant, with a year-on-year decrease of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Exports of electronic components fell 20.1% year-on-year, the largest drop in 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits fell 18.3% year-on-year, the largest drop in 14 years.

Cai Mina, the director of the statistics department, said that this shows that the weak demand effect of the consumer electronics industry has spread, and the electronics industry has entered the adjustment period.
Statistics show that Taiwan's exports and imports both fell in January, with exports only reaching US$2.34 billion, the lowest level in nearly three years.

The Taiwanese government's financial affairs management department believes that the global terminal demand is decreasing, the industry adjustment is inhibiting the purchase of merchants, and the export situation is difficult to improve in the short term. The export decline in the first quarter of Taiwan may be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) of Taiwan's manufacturing industry in January was adjusted for seasonality to 40.4%, a decrease of 3.3 percentage points from the previous year, and a continuous decline for seven months.
In the economic monitoring indicators system, PMI is 50% as the line of death, and the index greater than 50% represents the expansion of the situation, and the opposite is the contraction.
In January, five components of Taiwan's PMI showed that new orders, production, and employment were shrinking, delivery times from suppliers were decreasing, and inventory was shrinking.

All six major industries reported a contraction in their PMI, with the industries ranked by the speed of contraction as follows: electrical machinery and equipment (35.1%), electronics and optoelectronics (35.2%), chemical and pharmaceutical (39.2%), basic raw materials (42.4%), transportation equipment (42.6%), and food and textiles (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the "Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" of the Taiwan government announced that the CPI annual growth rate in January 2021 was 3.04%, which exceeded 3% for the first time since July 2020.
Vegetable prices rose 28.25%, a 17-month high.

Cao Zhihong, a special committee member of the Taiwan "Bureau of Budget, Accounting, and Statistics", admitted that the increase in food prices was indeed greater than expected. Excluding the influence of the Chinese New Year, the average CPI in January and February of this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and inflationary pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking at Taiwan’s economy this year, experts are pessimistic, according to reports in the United Daily News and “Yahoo Finance” and other domestic media.

Professor Wu Da Ren of the Economics Department of Central University in Taiwan analyzed that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for exporters in the manufacturing industry, and the risk of debt default will increase.
At the same time, reduced orders lead to businesses cutting labor costs, which affects the labor market and family income, which in turn affects consumer spending.

Qu Dashan, a researcher at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the Eurozone and the United States have not yet resolved their inflation situation, and that demand continues to shrink. Therefore, it is estimated that the export decline in Taiwan will continue into the first half of the year.
Taiwan's economy is export-oriented, and is affected by the decline in exports, so the annual economic growth will be less than last year.

China News Service, Beijing, February 11 (Doctor Mou Rui) The 2022 China Sea Returnee Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the "Report") released recently shows that the number of graduating students in 2022 increased by 8.6% compared to the previous year, the number of returnee students seeking employment after studying abroad reached a new high, and the demand for foreign talent in Chinese enterprises also
The report pointed out that the number of returning students seeking jobs in China has increased significantly since 2020, and the number of students seeking jobs after graduation has increased.

Compared with 2021, the number of students who will study abroad in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of students who will return to seek employment after studying abroad reached a new high.

The number of prospective students from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia decreased year-on-year.
The supply and demand of talents returning to the sea after the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: 2022 China Returning to the Sea Employment Survey Report

Data shows that the demand for foreign talents by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for returning overseas talents is on the rise.

The number of returning overseas Chinese seeking jobs in China has changed in recent years. Source: 2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report.

By region, the intention to develop in first-tier, second-tier and third-tier cities and below in 2022 has increased, with the proportion of investment in 2022 being 31%, 15.7% and 14.3% respectively, all higher than the investment proportion in 2021.
For the harvest of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that it basically met their expectations, which increased by 2.8 percentage points compared with last year (49.9%).
Twenty-eight point two percent of the repatriations exceeded or significantly exceeded expectations, a figure that was higher than the 25.4 percent in 2021.

to build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

The government will formulate public wireless local area network (WLAN) service standards, promote the upgrading of WLANs in areas with high population density and high information consumption to provide gigabit access capabilities.

the plan clearly states that the construction of the smart city will be carried out in a collaborative manner.

explore the construction of the city perception terminal construction management mode based on the "open source penguin" operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, accelerate the construction of the city-level IoT perception platform, promote the urban IoT platform, and promote the interconnection and data interoperability of the professional IoT platform in various fields.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things in urban management, public services, public security, transportation, travel, etc., and expand the fixed perception and intelligent network connection of urban roads, buildings, public facilities, etc. to the mobile perception collection channels of intelligent connected vehicles.

New Variables Emerge in China’s E-commerce Industry, How to Make Delivery “King of Content”?
- China News Service
China News Service, February 11th  New Variables Emerge in China’s E-commerce Industry, How Can Delivery Services Achieve “Content is King”?
Xia Bin, reporter of China Securities Journal
"We were late to the e-commerce game, but we knew from the start that to stand out from the millions of stores out there, content is key.
"Flower" is a 90s girl from Guangdong, who now operates a supplementary food store on Douyin, helping a 30-year-old offline store to "bloom" online.
The video, which mimics the style of old Hong Kong movies and features classic Cantonese songs, was posted on @芳芳一人食's TikTok account, and the beautiful video is a breath of fresh air.
In the recent Douyin e-commerce "Find Your Peers · Quality Content Sharing Area", Fangfang, as a quality creator, attended the meeting and introduced her daily creation experience and feelings.

She said at the scene, "The carefully prepared video attracted a lot of attention from the netizens, many people are interested in the ingredients in my home and want to cook together, and the traffic suddenly opened up.

Fangfang relies on live streaming to make more people fall in love with the taste of "Old Guangzhou", and a live broadcast can sell up to 300,000 supplementary ingredients, saving a family business from the brink of closure.
"No content, no e-commerce", as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live broadcast e-commerce, live broadcast rooms often use low prices and discounts to attract users, and price advantage seems to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there are not only super-level influencers like Liu Zhiming and Dongfang Zhenzhen, but also many experts and merchants who are not well known by the general public, but who have emerged in vertical niches. They have achieved long-term operational benefits by continuously creating high-quality content that is in line with their brand image.

High Ashen, the operator of the author star of Douyin e-commerce, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into reality through Douyin e-commerce, and the growth of content creation is 252%, and the total transaction amount is more than twice.
"Behind these numbers we can feel a vibrant, vital author ecosystem.
"said hoya.

The School of Communication and Design Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform of Beijing Normal University has released the "E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report", which analyzes the importance of "new variables" in the current e-commerce industry, namely high-quality content, from the data perspective, and uses the index to evaluate the ecosystem of content on 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the report, the e-commerce industry ecological health index ranking is as follows: Douyin e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, JD.com.

The report believes that the e-commerce content ecology is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional user-generated content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integration with e-commerce. The higher the value of the content platform, the richer the scenarios of consumption and promotion, the higher the possibility of e-commerce impl

On the scene, Professor Yu Guoming, Dean of the School of Journalism and Communication at Beijing Normal University, and Chairman of the China Media Economy and Management Special Committee, made an analysis and interpretation of the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has transitioned from the “affordability” stage to the “quality of consumption” stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the root and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development. Knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leaders) and other PGC content have become standard in e-commerce live broadcasting.
In looking at the future development of the e-commerce industry, Yin Guoming proposed two suggestions.

One is to look at it from the perspective of promoting the health and quality of the ecology of e-commerce content from the perspective of the improvement of the content structure, build positive standards for content creation and management, and realize the dynamic balance of the index system of the health of the ecology of e-commerce content.
Another is to look at the external ecology, to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value of cooperation and co-creation with the external environment.

“The future of e-commerce industry needs more data and AI support to make predictions of stability of future development; in addition, it provides more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, realizes the value of collaboration between enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and creates a healthy content ecology.
" (End)

Chinese Rescue Team Continues to Conduct Rescue Operations in Turkey, Rescues 4 Trapped People - Eastday.com

China News Service, February 11 -- According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team in Turkey sent out 3 action teams and 45 rescue personnel, and rescued 1 trapped person.
Two search and assessment teams were dispatched to evaluate the 15-story building on Wadalaba Street.
So far, four people have been rescued, five bodies have been found, and 25 severely damaged buildings have been searched for signs of life and assessed for risk.
The rescue team will scientifically adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation in the disaster area and the situation at the rescue site, and continue to carry out rescue work.

The rescue team obtained the information of seeking help through various channels such as the embassy, local government, and UN relief organizations, and verified it through online inquiry, on-site search, etc. one by one.
The team introduced the current rescue environment and the situation of building collapse to the Hong Kong Rescue Team, and jointly carried out search operations.

Currently, 3 members are sent to work at the 5th region rescue coordination center, responsible for the coordination of the joint rescue area with the Italian rescue team, and communicate with the rescue teams of Italy, the United Kingdom, Serbia, Slovakia, and Oman, to understand the situation of rescue work of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection, and followed the principle of "unified command and safety first" to strengthen the safety management of the rescue site, strengthen the requirements for the discipline of the rescue work, and clarify the safety precautions.
Continuously operate the rotation standby and sentry duty system, and strengthen the management of camp security.

The medical personnel of the rescue team provide daily physical examination services for the team members, strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and currently all members of the rescue team are in good health, and the team is conducting a sweep in the camp.

After the self-sustaining area was established, the logistics support personnel jointly built 26 tents for command and communication, equipment storage, medical cleaning and disinfection, living accommodation, and kennels in four categories, ensuring the supply of more than 30 sets of rescue equipment on the scene.

(Voice of Germany in Chinese) The Biden administration will add six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the balloon espionage plan to the blacklist on Friday (February 10).

The U.S. Commerce Department said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute help modernize the Chinese military, especially in the aerospace field, including aircraft and helicopters.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.
The list is known as the "entity list," and companies on it are barred from buying U.S. technology or goods unless they obtain a special license from the U.S. Commerce Department.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing South River Aerospace Science and Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Dongguan Lingshan Feeling Technology Co., Ltd., Tianmen Aerospace Science and Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xingshan Aerospace Science and Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Tianmen Aerospace Science and Technology Group

The White House had previously signaled that it was considering broader measures to "expose and counter" what it said were larger-scale surveillance operations by China that threatened U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has further strained the US-China relationship, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.
China’s government has lodged a serious protest with the US embassy in Beijing, criticizing the US for seriously damaging and harming the efforts and progress of the stable China-US relationship.

Based on existing wreckage evidence and information from China's procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has direct relations with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier by the Chinese military.

On Friday, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Mao Ning said at a press conference that China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position regarding the accidental intrusion of Chinese unmanned aerial vehicles into US airspace due to unavoidable circumstances.
She added that the US Congress's related decision was purely political manipulation and hype, according to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
China strongly opposes this and firmly opposes it.

"Today's action demonstrates that we are taking steps to enforce and stop China's use of surveillance balloons that have violated U.S. and dozens of other countries' airspace," said Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Export Enforcement.
A staff member of Guangzhou Tianhe Xinghang Aerospace Technology Co. Ltd. said he was unaware of the sanctions and declined to comment further, Reuters reported.
China's Embassy in the United States has not yet commented on this information.

According to the Associated Press, a family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in the town of Nurdai in the disaster-stricken province of Nadia, West Bengal.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the pile of debris, and then found the father, but he insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were rescued in freezing conditions.

According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Despite experts saying people can survive more than a week in a wreck, hopes of finding more survivors are fading.
Rescue workers are still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life under the rubble.

UN official: 'Century-defining' disaster in region

He also praised Turkey's "extraordinary" response to the disaster.
He told Reuters he hoped to provide aid to both the Syrian government and opposition-controlled areas, but said the situation was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in aid to the people affected by the earthquake in Syria.
Earlier this week, the UN announced a $25 million allocation for Turkey and Syria to fight the epidemic.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Chilean Earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded on the Richter scale occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just 10 minutes, Wadia destroyed an entire city.
After the earthquake, a huge roar hit the coast of Chile, causing waves as high as 25 meters.
The typhoon has reached faraway Japan and the Philippines.
The number of casualties and economic losses caused by such a wide-ranging disaster is impossible to know.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska Earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964, was a Friday, and it was Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, with a magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was the third largest earthquake in the world's history.
When the earthquake occurred, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near the entrance to the College Fjord, in William Sound.
The quake lasted between three and five minutes in most areas.
The undersea landslide triggered a massive underwater landslide, 67 meters high.
Since it was a holiday, the school and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake left 139 people injured.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while 130 others died from the tsunami triggered by the quake.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two 7+ magnitude strong earthquakes occurred in Tangshan City, Hebei Province, China, within 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers below the surface.
Tangshan City, the whole city's transportation, communication, water supply, and power supply were cut off, and it was leveled to the ground in a short time.
The capital Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, 242,769 people died and 164,851 people were injured in all the affected areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China with records, only second to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
But some foreign scientists estimate that at least 650,000 people may have died in the earthquake.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, a magnitude 9.1 to 9.3 earthquake occurred 160 km west of the coast of Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia, with a depth of 30 km.
The quake triggered waves as high as 15 to 30 feet.
A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst-hit areas including Aceh in Indonesia, Phuket in Thailand, Bali, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

The earthquake occurred during the peak tourist season, and the disaster-stricken area was crowded with tourists and local residents, causing many tourists who were enjoying their vacation on the beach and local people who were working on the beach to be swept away by the waves, making many people missing.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people have died or gone missing.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan Earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data of the China Earthquake Bureau, the surface wave intensity of this earthquake reached 8.2 degrees, and the rectangular intensity reached 8.3 degrees, causing more than 100,000 square kilometers of damage.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 692,270 people to be injured, 17,923 people to be missing, 374,643 people to be injured to different degrees, 19.93 million people to lose their homes, and the total population affected was 46.26 million.
It was the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and the most tragic earthquake after the Tangshan earthquake.

On March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12th would be designated as Disaster Reduction Day, and that efforts would be made to strengthen public education and attention to disaster reduction and mitigation.
Afterwards, many local governments and primary and middle schools in China hold earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and middle schools are also beginning to pay attention to the popularization of "disaster prevention and reduction" education.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurred in the Caribbean Sea.
The epicenter is located 25 kilometers southwest of Taizhou, the capital of Hainan Province, and is about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimates that about 300,000 people were affected by the earthquake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 20,000 deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, more than 90% of the homes were destroyed in the earthquake.
Although the international community has provided a great deal of aid and support, the countries with overpopulation have never recovered from this disaster.
The strongest earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tohoku Earthquake (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a large reverse fault earthquake of magnitude 9.0 occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter of the earthquake was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the depth of the earthquake was measured at 24 kilometers, which triggered a tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This is the first earthquake of magnitude 9 or greater ever recorded in Japan.
Some 22,000 people died and about 400,000 buildings were destroyed or badly damaged.
The Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, resulting in a leakage accident.
The accident was classified as a level 7 event on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES), the highest level.
the Fukushima nuclear accident caused the detection of trace amounts of radioactive materials worldwide, including iodine-131 and cesium-137 (half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean.
According to the United Nations statistics, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of the two countries are in urgent need of food.
In just Ecuador, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food for refugees displaced by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area has dropped to zero, and many victims have no place to stay.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but many of those in desperate need are still unable to receive aid.
In war-torn Syria, where the conflict has raged for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the misery of the population.
In the four days since the earthquake, the World Food Programme has provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of external injuries and emergency surgery.

Recently, the police received several cases of telecommunications fraud. The criminals pretended to be Telstra Corporation and sent fraudulent text messages containing website links to the victims, claiming that their points would expire soon and they should redeem them as soon as possible. They then tricked the victims into logging into the fake website to redeem the points.

The victim entered their credit card information and security code as instructed and immediately received a notification from their financial institution that there were unauthorized charges on their credit card, leading them to believe that their information was stolen from the above-mentioned website.
It was found that the relevant telecommunications companies did not send the above SMS.

The Traffic Police Bureau called on the public to be vigilant if they receive similar text messages and not to log in to the website link in the text message or provide any personal information. If they are asked to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, transaction verification codes, they should be even more cautious to prevent credit card theft.
Anti-fraud reminder:
1. Pay more attention to network security information, improve personal awareness of prevention;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information, to prevent theft;
3. Beware of fake websites and phishing websites, and always check whether the website address is completely the same as the official website;
4. Install antivirus software on your phone, mobile device, or computer and keep it updated;
5. If you suspect you have been scammed or are a victim of a crime, call the Police Fraud Hotline 8800 7777 or the Police Reporting Hotline 999 to seek help.
