Google AI Chatbot "Got It Wrong" Mother Company Stock Vaporized Billions of Dollars
(Compiled on 11th)

Google's new AI chatbot Bard has had a rocky debut, "answering questions incorrectly" in a promotional video, causing the stock price of Google's parent company Alphabet to plunge 8.9% on Tuesday, falling below $100 for the first time, and wiping out $110 billion (about CNY 4765 billion) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is concerned that Alphabet is not keeping up with its competitor Microsoft.

According to Reuters, Google released the promotional video of AI chatbot Bard earlier than expected. In the video, someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries can I tell my 9-year-old child about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST)?
"Bard mentioned in his answer that the telescope had taken the first photograph of a planet outside our solar system.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration of the United States, the first photograph of the extrasolar planet was taken by the "great telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the news under the title of "Bard's Answer Causes Alphabet Stock to Plummet".

On the other hand, Google said that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing process," and it will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards of quality, safety and truthfulness."
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021.

(Summary of 11th day) Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it is expected that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 will reach 12-14 million, which will bring about S$1.8-2.1 billion in tourism revenue; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to about 67%-75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019;
The Singapore tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) show that the number of visitors to Singapore in 2022 increased by 19 times compared to 2021, reaching 6.3 million, exceeding the STB's earlier forecast of 4-6 million, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue was S$8.96 billion, and it is expected that the tourism revenue for the whole year of 2022 will reach S$13.8 billion to S$14.3 billion, which is 6 to 7 times that of 2021's S$1.89 billion, and has already recovered to about 50% to
Singapore government takes multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly 50 million yuan to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The tourism board recently announced plans to withdraw 110 million yuan from the budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

To make health and wellness a new tourism highlight in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) launched a public consultation on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination along the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Liling, the Executive Director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put physical health at the top of their considerations.

Developing a health and wellness destination in Pasir Ris Park, with its beach and coastal walk, could contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy by encouraging visitors to spend more time and money in the country.
Chen Bon Lan, the director of Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
the COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Office has been promoting health and wellness programs to both local and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 health and wellness activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences for visitors.

Besides the new Singapore Children's Museum, the world of Avanda at Pasir Ris Beach Garden, the Central Beach Market at St John's Island, the new "Explore New Frontiers" gallery at the ArtScience Museum, and the outdoor amphitheatre at the Night Safari, the Tourism Board will support the development and updating of projects such as the Wildlife Reserves' Bird Park, to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate industry standards for meetings, exhibitions and incentive travel for sustainable development of the tourism industry within 2023, focusing on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions, and further optimizing the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry is accelerating the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, the passenger flow of Tianjin Airport has recovered strongly, with daily passenger volume reaching 150,000 and weekly passenger volume reaching 1 million, which is about 75% of the pre-epidemic level. The number of employees in the aviation industry has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-epidemic level.

Data shows that Singapore received 23.6 million visitors from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic level. It also operated 170,000 flights, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic level.
The recovery of the tourism industry is driving the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and tourism industry are placing high hopes on the Chinese market.

Ms Koh Su Dan, Assistant Director of International Marketing of Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey of the China Travel Platform showed that Singapore's safety index ranked among the top three in the world, which was one of the reasons why Chinese tourists loved Singapore.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese people traveled to Singapore for vacation each year.
With China's relaxed border policy, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to one-third to one-half of that in 2019.
Cui Su Dan said that the tourism bureau will closely follow the further relaxation of China's outbound travel policy and respond to the changes in the needs of tourists.

Singapore Tourism Board (STB) will not only strengthen partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, but also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in line with the new trends of outbound tourism in China.

Looking ahead to the 2023 travel market, Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the recovery of the travel industry will be faster than expected, as long as the global economy does not experience a significant downturn that affects public income, and there are no new large-scale outbreaks of deadly diseases.

"Fund E-account" is coming: CSRC authorizes development of investors' unified collection and inquiry of all funds under their names - Economic Observer - Professional financial news website
Economic Observer Network, Chen Jian, is the complexity of the purchase channel leading to the difficulty of collecting account information?
Do you forget the "little treasure chest"?
The base's problems are about to be solved.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E-account" APP was listed in various mobile app stores and was undergoing public testing.

According to the introduction, the "Fund E-Account" is a one-stop query service for individual investors to provide public fund account and share information, which aims to solve the pain points of the industry service of forgetting accounts and querying difficulties for the majority of small and medium investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 public fund management companies in China, managing assets of about 2.6 trillion yuan; there are 167 public fund registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each registration authority has its own account system, which lacks a unified industry query channel.

Some industry insiders said that by the end of 2021, the number of investors in China's mutual funds exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the population in the country invested in mutual fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about purchase situations through different sales channels, but through the "Fund E-Account", they can inquire about purchase situations through all sales channels, and the holding situation of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-Account" APP?

According to the relevant documents, the "Fund E-Account" App is a mobile application developed and constructed by the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) for the public fund industry gateway, which can provide investors with a one-stop query for the holding of off-market shareholdings of public fund products in the entire market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly learn about their holdings of offshore units of public fund products managed by fund managers through the "Fund E-Account", which will improve the efficiency of inquiries.

Specifically, investors can obtain information through the “Fund E-Account” such as the information of fund accounts opened by fund managers in the market, the information of trading accounts opened by sales institutions of public funds, and the holding situation of the products of the off-exchange shareholding, which are not subject to the limit of 200 investors, including public fund investment funds and investment funds managed by securities companies.

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities and Funds Evaluation Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can know all their offshore public fund holdings through the "Fund E-Account" App, which helps them find their "forgotten assets". More importantly, it collects all the account information of the comprehensive fund investment for customers, helping them to better understand their investment situation, and thus optimize their fund portfolio allocation and financial planning
How do I register?

Reporters noted that the "Fund E-account" app is currently available in the app stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile phone brands, but the app is still in the public beta testing stage, and registration requires filling in an invitation code, which investors can obtain by contacting the fund manager of the fund they hold.

A customer service staff member of a large or medium-sized public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the reporter of Economic Observer and said, "The APP is in the trial operation stage. China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can call to get them, and we will provide them.
After the trial run is over, users will be able to register without an invitation code.

The reporter registered an account and completed the query according to the download and use instructions of the "Fund E-Account" download and use instructions published on the website of the CSRC, and the entire process took only a few minutes, which was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After completing the real-name authentication, click the “Asset” fund binding button, and all fund products purchased by the reporter on various fund sales platforms are displayed in the binding options list (can be bound to the account), and after completing the binding, the reporter can see the total assets of the funds invested and can start using the query function.
It should be noted that the "Fund E-account" only provides query services for investors and cannot redeem or purchase.
The data displayed in the "Fund E-Account" is generally the data of three trading days before the date when the user inquires (T day).

For example, when you open the "Fund E-account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before that day, which is February 7.

The Federation of Korean Trade Unions Calls for a Mass Rally against the Government’s Retirement Reform Plan
On Saturday (February 11), French unions called for a nationwide mobilization against the government's pension reform bill, calling on the public to take to the streets to express their views.
This is the fourth day of social actions against the bill to reform the retirement pension system.
The number of people who respond to the rally call may affect the next move of the labor group.
This is the fourth nationwide mobilization in a month by the eight major French trade union confederations, and the first time that the rally has been scheduled for a Saturday.

Given that Saturday is a day off for most French people, they don't have to choose between taking part in protests or strikes, and so the unions hope that today's demonstrations will attract more people.

The unions of the subway and bus systems and the public railway companies have not called for a strike today, so the bus and subway systems should operate normally, and citizens can take the bus or subway to the rally site. At the same time, people can travel normally to their destinations for the winter vacation in areas where schools have started the winter vacation.
Union groups hope for more than 100,000 to attend the rally, while police expect a national turnout of between 60,000 and 80,000, with 9,000 to 12,000 in Paris.

Since the start of the protest against the government's pension reform plan, although polls show that the majority of the French people do not support the measure of postponing the statutory retirement age from the current 62 years old to 64 years old, the number of people who really go out to participate in the demonstrations has gradually decreased.
The first strike demonstration on January 31st mobilized 12.7 to 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters has shrunk from 7.57 million to between 2 million and 2 million.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition, especially in the opposition group led by the progressive left, numerous amendments were submitted, which slowed down the review process.
The debate between the pro-government and opposition camps has become increasingly sharp and fierce.

A French MP from the hard-left La France Insoumise party has sparked a row after posting a picture of himself on social media standing on a balloon with the face of Labour Minister Muriel Penicaud on it.
The speaker of the National Assembly finally announced a 15-day ban on the lawmaker's participation in the assembly activities as a punishment for the behavior.
Although the reform plan has sparked the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has so far made only minor adjustments to the bill and no major concessions.
The union is preparing to launch another action next Thursday, March 7, when the reform bill is sent to the Senate for discussion, and plans to organize a demonstration.

Last East German Communist Leader Dies
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "Hans Modrow left us last night, aged 95.
So we have lost a great leader.
In November 1989, just four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, separating East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to resign because of the protests in East Germany demanding democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, after coming to power in the Soviet Union, also demanded reforms in Eastern Europe, which was under Soviet leadership.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic.
The election results forced him to resign as prime minister.
Despite Moldova's reforms, opponents accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and unification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modero was found guilty of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to jail.
The charges have been called politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German Bundestag and from 1999 to 2004 as a member of the European Parliament.
Modrak sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told The Associated Press that he did not want the old East Germany back, but that it should be recognized for its achievements.
Modrzejewski was born in 1928 in the small German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was a leader of the youth fire brigade and a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi paramilitary organization that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles of the war.
At 17, Modro was captured by the Soviets and taken to the USSR, where he took anti-fascist courses and became a staunch communist.

In 1949, the year of the founding of the German Democratic Republic, he returned to his homeland and found a job as a mechanic while continuing to study sociology and economics and earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a functionary of the Free German Youth, a movement that almost all East German young people joined, and from 1973 to 1989 he rose through the ranks of the Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the district party in Dessau.
He served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, taking on the highest state office.

The earthquake disaster relief continues day and night.
Rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working around the clock in the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings since the powerful quake hit Turkey and Syria.
In the cold, they often call for quiet, because they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble.
Two more women have been rescued from the rubble of the earthquake, Reuters reported today.
However, the death toll from the earthquake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey's death toll has reached 20,665, while more than 3,500 people have died in Syria.

The 7.8-magnitude earthquake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and approaching the 2003 Bam earthquake in Iran, which killed 31,000 people.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.
Two women were rescued from the rubble of collapsed buildings in Turkey on Saturday, 122 hours after the country's deadliest earthquake in 20 years, officials said.
Another injured man, 55, was confirmed as Masallah Cicek, who was pulled from the ruins of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the southeastern Turkish city.
In the cold, rescuers often plead for silence, as they struggle to hear any sign of life amid the rubble.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescuers huddled under a concrete slab, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes and was carried to a field hospital wrapped in a blanket, cradling his baby Yagiz Ulas.
Video images showed rescuers also taking away his mother, who was dazed and pale on the stretcher but conscious.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people were rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and 31,000 rescue personnel were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals, while 1.05 million were homeless and crammed into temporary shelters.
With many people lacking food in the cold winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, the official media reported, marking his first visit to a quake-hit area since the devastating earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwestern Syria were running out because the war situation made aid work difficult.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the Adiyaman province in Turkey and admitted that the government's response was not fast enough.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Elder, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 but may have to postpone it because of the disaster.
The Associated Press said that the anger over the delay in providing aid and starting rescue work could affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the toughest challenge to Erdogan's 20-year rule.
Ertadoan called for unity and denounced what he called a "negative campaign" for political purposes.
Turkey's main opposition leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu criticized the government's response.
"The earthquake was big, but what was worse was the lack of coordination, lack of planning and incompetence," critics said.

What is the "object" that was shot down in Alaska?
I'm lost in the darkness, guessing wildly
The US military used its most advanced stealth fighter, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying in US airspace over Alaska on Friday afternoon, the Pentagon said.
The crash site was about 10 miles from the coast of Alaska.
It was the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an airborne object.
A Chinese spy balloon floated in the skies over the United States for several days last week before being shot down off the coast of South Carolina, the Pentagon said on Friday.

The second object to be shot down entered US airspace for the first time Thursday night, and was tracked by the US military as it moved through the skies above northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon says there's no evidence that the object is controllable.

John Cohen, the White House national security council's strategic communications coordinator, said Friday that while the specific shape of the object flying in the sky was unclear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft."
Kobe said the object was different from the spy balloon found over the United States, which had a "payload" hanging from it.
"We call it an object because that's the best description we can give it," Bryant said.
Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the strike on the object, Coburn said, adding that the president made the decision "very carefully."
The official description of the object boils down to: about the size of a small car, no control surfaces, no visible means of propulsion, flying at about 10,000 feet.
But they don't answer basic questions, like what is this object, what country does it belong to, what is it doing.
Many online analyses and speculations believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.

It may have come from China, like the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, both of which were performing some kind of task in different locations.
Some have even compared the Alaska object to a UFO.
The report cited a tweet from former U.S. Rep. Peter Meijer on Friday that said, "I hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon and not a UFO."
"It's a bit of a joke to conflate alien spacecraft with weather balloons, but it's not worth blowing up the world over," Meeks said.
McGee tweeted this out shortly after Kobe proved that this object in Alaska was hit.
The magazine said that it was not just Megacea who suspected that the object was a UFO.

Tennessee Republican Rep. Tim Burchett criticized the government's handling of information last month and called on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to release a report on the "unidentified aerial phenomena."

I don't recommend reading it.
I read it a long time ago, and by chance I saw some reviews written by people who read it, so I thought I'd write my own review.
This is not a collection of short stories, but rather a collection of fragments of love in life.
The tone of the book is very flat, like plain water, the pursuit of simplicity in expression and sentence construction is extreme, and the plot is as quiet and flat as a summer afternoon street.
Each short story is a snippet of time from an ordinary life, without a beginning or an end.
They were collected together in the album "When We Talk About Love We're Talking About Nothing".

I think that the collection of stories and its title are a kind of behavioral art, which the author wants to express that love is not only the tragic love and happiness on the stage, the urban legend of the dried sea and the broken stone, nor is it only the glue-like and lacquer-like you and me, love is not only the above, nor should it be represented by the above, love is also the ordinary life, the tedious and tasteless daily

Reading this book might bring to mind the quarrelling couple you sat next to on the plane, the friend of a friend whose marriage seems to have lost its spark, or the relationship that just didn't work out.

That's why I don't recommend reading it, from a reviewer's perspective, the writing and plot are both bland, unless your life is a rollercoaster of drama or you live in Candyland, in which case you'll feel like you're reading something that's either not worth the time or just plain weird.

And on a deeper level, the anecdotes don't illuminate or expand the characters' thoughts or perspectives (unlike in Marx's "The Time of the Doves"), and the brief scenes don't explore any issues, such as what kind of mistakes lead to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the protagonist's marital breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter.
The author's ideas are more often expressed through technique and form than through plot, which is why the reading experience is less satisfying.
It's good for rough reading, but not for detailed reading.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not enough.
They have explained a lot about what sales theory is and why, but they are weak in how to do it. They just point out the direction but do not give specific ways.
Also, this book feels like it was put together.
There are examples both in the country and abroad, both among well-known entrepreneurs and salesmen and among people who are not well-known.
I don't know if it's a story made up to illustrate a point, but if it's a story about an author's own experience, it would be more convincing.
The term for customers is constantly changing.
The title is still customers, and the content is changed to customers.
spelling errors, missing punctuation, and numbering errors were also found in the eBooks.
In summary, this book is a good choice for a theoretical introduction, but it is not suitable for people who have been engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales level.
A quick guide to internet finance
This book is shallow, can be said to be a textbook, can help everyone quickly understand the full picture of Internet finance, but to understand in depth, still need to follow the picture to dig.

The time when Ma Huateng wrote the book was earlier, and the supplementary content of PayPal, WeChat, and the cultivation of user habits were not mentioned later. Now, the share of third-party payment is probably not as small as what was mentioned in the book.
Nowadays, many people take their mobile phones when they go out to eat, and merchants also abandon UnionPay because of high bank card turnover.

But I am very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It can be seen that the author has at least many years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the history of financial development in the country and abroad, so he can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It's easy to write high-flown prose, but it's hard to write prose that's easy to understand.
i want to show you, and i want you to know!
The first thing that determines a person's job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether he or she is respected and appreciated at work.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, once basic human survival needs are met, the most pressing need is for psychological needs to be met - the need to be understood, affirmed, and recognized.
Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are "love you in the heart", even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their heart and will not say it out loud.
In this book, the author outlines five languages of appreciation: the languages of affirmation, appreciation, attention, service, and touch.

What matters is not that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you use them to appreciate, to thank, to praise, to acknowledge, to affirm the people in your life -- the family members, the friends, the colleagues.
The more intimate the relationship, the more we need to praise and thank each other, so that our lives will be more beautiful.
If companies learn to praise, they can retain talent to a certain extent and reduce turnover.
Thank you for bringing us such interesting ideas and the world from abroad.

the worst shopping experience in history

On the evening of September 23, my wife dropped her phone. I immediately ordered a new one from Lima, Peru for 8p, but it was not self-pickup and there was no additional charge (I was secretly happy). Since it was not self-pickup, the delivery time was slower, and the system showed that the latest delivery date was September 27.

My wife doesn't have a phone and it's hard to live without one. She called me at 6:30 in the morning the next day to think of a solution. After looking at the Jingdong website, I found that there was 256GB in stock and could be delivered the same day, so I had to order another one immediately.
I just bought a new one, so I want to cancel the order for the Amazon right away.

Because the order was placed at midnight, it was impossible to receive the delivery in the middle of the night. At 7:30 in the morning, I called the customer service to request cancellation of the order, and the customer service replied that the order had been canceled and I should wait for the SMS notification.

OK, I just waited patiently, and when I checked my phone at noon, the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted customer service to ask them to cancel the order, and the customer service replied that they had already operated OK.

At 3pm, I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I couldn't help it and had to contact customer service again to confirm that I had called three times and asked them to cancel the order and notify the seller not to ship the item!

The customer service rep contacted the seller at my request and told me the seller was unfamiliar with the system and would have to wait until he was familiar with it before he could cancel the order.
But I was told that the seller already knew, so I was reassured that it would not be shipped.
When I checked the orders on Monday, I found that they had already been shipped, and I was speechless.
I couldn't contact the seller directly, so I had to call customer service again.
The back-end processing was just unbelievable. I basically told them what to do, and they would follow my instructions.
The order is still in the status of delivery refusal, and is preparing to be delivered again!
won't Amazon just come after you?
The seller company has already received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In summary, I will never pay in advance for big things again, it's too troublesome.
